name: Spaghetti Bolognese
description: Recipe video above. My everyday Bolognese recipe I make over and over again. This Meat Sauce has terrific depth of flavour for such a quick recipe - though if you have the time, it's stellar cooked slowly for a couple of hours. My 3 "secret" tips are: Worcestershire Sauce, Beef Bouillon Cubes and a touch of sugar.Â
recipeIngredient: 1  onion (, finely chopped (brown, yellow or white))
1 lb / 500g   beef mince (ground beef) (OR half pork, half beef (Note 1))
1/2 cup (125 ml)  dry red wine ((sub water or beef broth/stock))
2  beef bouillon cubes (, crumbled OR granulated beef bouillon (Note 2))
800g / 28 oz  can crushed tomato ((or tomato passata))
2  sprigs fresh thyme ((or 1/2 tsp dried thyme or oregano))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large pot or deep skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes or until light golden and softened.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large pot or deep skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic, cook for 3 minutes or until light golden and softened.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn heat up to high and add beef. Cook, breaking it up as your go, until browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn heat up to high and add beef. Cook, breaking it up as your go, until browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Add red wine. Bring to simmer and cook for 1 minute, scraping the bottom of the pot, until the alcohol smell is gone.
recipeInstructions.name: Add red wine. Bring to simmer and cook for 1 minute, scraping the bottom of the pot, until the alcohol smell is gone.

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining ingredients except salt and pepper. Stir, bring to a simmer then turn down to medium so it bubbles gently. Cook for 20 - 30 minutes (no lid), adding water if the sauce gets too thick for your taste. Stir occasionally.
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining ingredients except salt and pepper. Stir, bring to a simmer then turn down to medium so it bubbles gently. Cook for 20 - 30 minutes (no lid), adding water if the sauce gets too thick for your taste. Stir occasionally.

recipeInstructions.text: Slow simmer option: really takes this to another level, if you have the time!Â Add 3/4 cup of water, cover with lid and simmer on very low for 2 - 2.5 hours, stirring every 30 minutes or so. (Note 5) Uncover, simmer 20 minutes to thicken sauce. (Note 6 for slow cooker)
recipeInstructions.name: Slow simmer option: really takes this to another level, if you have the time!Â Add 3/4 cup of water, cover with lid and simmer on very low for 2 - 2.5 hours, stirring every 30 minutes or so. (Note 5) Uncover, simmer 20 minutes to thicken sauce. (Note 6 for slow cooker)

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust salt and pepper to taste right at the end. Serve over spaghetti - though if you have the time, I recommend tossing the sauce and pasta per steps below.
recipeInstructions.name: Adjust salt and pepper to taste right at the end. Serve over spaghetti - though if you have the time, I recommend tossing the sauce and pasta per steps below.

itemListElement.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add pasta and cook per packet directions MINUS 1 minute.
itemListElement.name: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add pasta and cook per packet directions MINUS 1 minute.

itemListElement.text: Scoop out a mug of pasta cooking water and set aside, then drain the pasta.
itemListElement.name: Scoop out a mug of pasta cooking water and set aside, then drain the pasta.

itemListElement.text: Add pasta into the bolognese sauce with about 1/2 cup (125 ml) of reserved pasta water over medium heat. Toss gently for 1 1/2 - 2 minutes, or until the spaghetti turns red and the sauce thickens.
itemListElement.name: Add pasta into the bolognese sauce with about 1/2 cup (125 ml) of reserved pasta water over medium heat. Toss gently for 1 1/2 - 2 minutes, or until the spaghetti turns red and the sauce thickens.

itemListElement.text: Divide between bowls. Garnish with parmesan and parsley if desired.
itemListElement.name: Divide between bowls. Garnish with parmesan and parsley if desired.

review.reviewBody:
Iâ€™ve made this before and making tonight - the smells are next level! 
Family eagerly hanging around.

Just made this the other night and it was fantastic! Which says alot because I am not a pasta person by any means. I made this for my partner as part of his meal plan with zucchini noodles and I liked it so much I made myself some pasta and had some- LOVED the flavors!

One person I served it to say it was a bit winey for them (she is not a wine person)- any alternatives to the wine or just leave it out next time? Thanks, Nagi, love your work!!

I made this ahead of time for a guest who arrived on a busy evening. Used the slow cook method and then reheated it in a slow cooker. Absolutely delicious! I served it with the red cabbage and julienned carrot salad and throw  together salad with greens, beetroot and feta, etc. Added anything that was in the fridge and suitable! A winning combo. Thank you Nagi ðŸ˜‹
This is pretty much my staple spag bol.  Next level hack, replace the bay leave with a star anise.... ðŸ¤¯
Yeah....another good one....It was sweet too....an I didn't use carrots....Next time...Thanx Nagi  :)
Best bolognese Iâ€™ve ever had! Shockingly delicious. Yet another one of Nagiâ€™s recipes added to the regular rotation!
I used to think mine was the best until I made this one.
Best Spag Bol I've had the pleasure of cooking. Everyone loved it.....thanks Nagi
So delicious in a slow cooker. I add an eggplant chopped finely and browned, and half a can of lentils. Ups the vege count, downs the cost per serve

Best Bolognese ever. Forget about any other recipe. This is the one. The quick version or the slow cooked version - the depth of flavour is amazing. And definitely add the spaghetti in to the sauce. Freezes well too - quick meals done.
Love this recipe! I sub the wine for our homemade bone broth and I also add some freeze dried beef organs and it tastes so bloody yum! The kids smash this without question every single time.

Just wanted to drop a line and say I made this recipe once and it instantly became a go-to and part of at least a bi-weekly rotation in my house.  I was home for Christmas and was able to scrape this recipe together from my momâ€™s pantry and knocked their socks off with it.  If you have the time (anyone reading this) the slow simmer on is absolutely the way to go.  Thank you so much for this recipe Nagi, itâ€™s a real winner.

This is the best bolognese recipe, always my go-to!! It's saucy (just how I like it) and tomato-ie rich. I add a few veggies and bacon to it, the kids doesn't even know there are veggies in there, win-win!! Thanks Nagi for your recipes ðŸ©·

keywords: Bolognese Sauce, Meat sauce, Spagetti Bolognese
